title: Population of regions in England in 2018
summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in each Region on the y axis.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is appeared to be the highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
Region South East has 3.43 times more Number of inhabitants (in millions) than Region North East which is has the lowest.
min_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in each Region on the y axis.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 9 columns on the x axis representing Region, and Number of inhabitants (in millions) in each Region on the y axis.
The Number of inhabitants (in millions) is appeared to be the highest at Region South East and lowest at Region North East.
Region South East has 3.43 times more Number of inhabitants (in millions) than Region North East which is has the lowest.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Number of inhabitants (in millions) for 9 number of Regions.
Region South East has the highest Number of inhabitants (in millions) and North East has the lowest Number of inhabitants (in millions).
There is a difference of 6.47 between the maximum Region South East and minimum Region North East.
Number of inhabitants (in millions) at Region South East is 9.13 , second place is London at 8.9, and thirdly is North West at 7.29.
The Region North East has 1.47 times less Number of inhabitants (in millions) than average.
